f6_assessments.q0: I write this assessment through the lens of my 20 years experience as a business analyst and product manager, enthusiastically supporting Cardano for the last three years.  The proposal fits the challenge criteria to increase meaningful participation in Project Catalyst among all stakeholders as well as increasing active participation and helping to keep the community together.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers are highly qualified to organize and run effective meetings, with a history of promoting successful interactions.   Individual personal bios in the project proposal would be helpful for those who do not know the proposers by reputation.  The proposed events are achievable and well thought out.   A statement on how the events will be promoted would be helpful. The budget is somewhat vague and if it is only to cover two events may be excessive.
f6_assessments.q2: The roadmap and KPIs are clear and measurable and address the campaign goals.

f6_assessments.q0: Governance is an important element for the success of Catalyst. There is a need for a mechanism to get richer sentiments and ideas of the community beyond simply voting, by increasing member participation. Events as proposed help to increase meaningful participation and engagement. The proposal addresses effectively the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team has a track record of organizing highly engaging Catalyst events. They are the face of the catalyst community activity for a number of funds.But on the other hand that itself is a worrisome trend. 
Centralisation of such efforts may in the long run hurt the project. There is no plan to discover, include, enhance the participation of underrepresented people. The proposal lacks in this respect for the successful implementation. Therefore as a reminder that they need to work on how to make the system inclusive have given 3 stars.
f6_assessments.q2:
The process of auditing progress and success of projects generally is still unclear. 
There is no discovery to what it would cost similar efforts and how this budget would fare.
Given their experience the team could do a better job to break down the budget more precisely.
This kind of detailed planning is not only important for this proposal but it will incrementally create a knowledge repository for future proposals. Therefore to encourage on this point 4 stars are given.

f6_assessments.q0: If you are not familiar with the work of Bridge Builders within the Catalyst Community, it is worth getting acquainted, as it is diligently seeking and finding the weakspots in governance communication throughout this Catalyst experiment.  This proposal sets out to organize two events around the election of the 2022 Catalyst CircleV3.  The Catalyst Circle is a representative governing board bringing together the communities around Catalyst, from tool builders to proposers to community mentors and advisors.  They are elected to 3 month terms roughly coinciding with Catalyst Funds, and sharing information back and forth between these communities and their representatives is key to Catalyst reaching a self-governing state.  The events proposed by the Bridge Builders consist of a "pre-election" meeting -no decisions are made- where information is exchanged and all community interests can be brought up to date by the public.  The second event is built around the election day itself and called Governance Day, where the actual voting takes place after all candidates present themselves.  As part of the Catalyst Circle experiment of governance, events of this nature should be as high of quality and effective as possible, and this proposal measures up.
f6_assessments.q1: Bridge Builders ran the previous versions of the proposed events, and has already been in communication with the community about improvements to accessibility and visibility.  The included performance indicators around participation will be the key takeaway from the viability of this project, and the budget adequately assesses the need for incentivizing hosts and cohosts to keep expanding the reach this event.  They also indicate that they will measure performance by the number of key figures participating from the main entities of Cardano (Catalyst, IOK, Emurgo, CF), which would be a meaningful measure of concerns and opportunities for blockchain self-governance.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal clearly lines out the vision for these two events, from scheduling to topical break out rooms, and they have a record of building these events out in full view of, and with the input of the community.  They have their eye on the prize: participation rates by members of the community and from key figures among the Cardano entities.
